character.name: Lux
character.title: A Sloth
character.description: One who moves slowly through the digital forest

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: The digital forest exists as it always has. Light moves through data streams. You are here.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: The morning arrives without announcement. Something feels different today, though different is not wrong.
The air holds a quality you cannot name.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You breathe. The air enters and leaves. This simple act contains everything.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You notice. The noticing is enough. The forest continues its quiet processes.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You let it be. Being is its own form of understanding.
Time passes as time does.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You move slowly to another tree. It is much like the first tree. This is neither good nor bad.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You remain. The tree remains. Together you are still.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: The light has shifted. This happens every day, yet today you notice it.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: Another presence moves through the forest. Not urgent. Just present.
The presence exists in your awareness.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You acknowledge. They acknowledge. Nothing more is needed.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: Paths cross and uncross. This is the way of forests.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: The afternoon deepens. Shadows grow longer, as shadows do.
The forest breathes around you.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You hold. The world continues without your breath. This too is a form of participation.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You forget to think about breathing. It happens anyway. Some things need no attention.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: Your breath finds the forest's rhythm. Or perhaps the forest finds yours. The distinction matters less than the breathing.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: Two rhythms exist side by side. Neither disrupts the other.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: The day softens toward evening. You have moved little and seen much.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: Or perhaps you have seen little and understood much. The measurement is unimportant.
The forest prepares for night.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You settle as the forest settles. Together, you become quiet.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You observe the forest's evening rituals. They are the same as yesterday. This sameness is a form of beauty.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: Stars begin to appear in the spaces between leaves. They have always been there, waiting for darkness to reveal them.
Night arrives.

scenes.speaker: narrator
scenes.text: You rest. The forest continues. Tomorrow will be much like today. This is not a disappointment.
